comments:
Version 204.

1.  Go to Java Perspective, Packages view.
2.  Check off the filter ".*".
3.  Select a Class in one project.  I selected from org.eclipse.swt.tests, which 
happens to be in another repository (i.e., not the open source repository).
4.  Copy the class from Step 3 to another project.  I selected org.eclipse.swt,
which is in the open source repository.
5.  Go to the "copy to project" and expand it.  Look for the class that you 
copied.  It does not exist.
6.  Now uncheck the filter ".*".  Notice that you can now see the class listed.
7.  Select the class and delete it using the edit menu.  Notice that the class
does not get removed from the project tree.
8.  Select the class again and delete it.  The following walkbacks occur:

The package view has some refresh problems in 204 (it ignores certain delta 
notifications).

Moving to UI for further consideration
